title: Shap.TreeExplainer for CatboostClassifier Segmentation Fault
body:
Hi team,

I observed a segmentation fault during the instanciation of a shap.TreeExplainer for a catboost.CatboostClassifier when depth >= 7 and classes_count >= 3.

```
from sklearn import datasets
import catboost
import shap

iris = datasets.load_iris()
X = iris.data
y = iris.target

classes_count = len(set(y))
depth = 7

model = catboost.CatBoostClassifier(depth=depth, classes_count=classes_count, verbose=False)
model.fit(X, y)
```
 
here we have a segmentation fault during the call to the
function compute_expectations written in shap/cext/tree_shap.h
I observed the bug only for depth >= 7 and for catboost.CatBoostClassifier with classes_count >= 3,
not for catboost.CatBoostRegressor
print("instanciate shap.TreeExplainer for catboost.CatBoostClassifier model with"\
      "depth = {} and classes_count = {}".format(depth, classes_count))

`explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model)`

`(test_catboost_2) ➜  engine git:(fix/catboost-explainer) ✗ python train_and_explain_tiny_multiclassification_catboost.py
IPython could not be loaded!
instanciate shap.TreeExplainer for catboost.CatBoostClassifier model withdepth = 7 and classes_count = 3
[1]    18975 segmentation fault (core dumped)  python train_and_explain_tiny_multiclassification_catboost.py
`

Please let me know if you need any other information.

regards
